subject: RE: [junit] Best Practices [General Topics]
msgSnippet: I have only been using JUnit for a few months and I am focusing on creating best practices templates for our development team. I would greatly appreciate the
messageBody:
I have only been using JUnit for a few months and I am focusing on
creating "best practices" templates for our development team.

I would greatly appreciate the insight of more experienced users.

If you have ideas for "Best Practices" that you think would be
beneficial to the users of JUnit, please reply to this email with the
topic.

If you would like to start a thread on a specific best practice,
please use the following format for the subject of the message:

[junit] Best Practices [Topic]

I'll volunteer to create summaries for the more popular topics.

//========================================================
// Suggested Topics for JUnit Best Practices
//========================================================
//
// What basic principles should I follow in creating tests?
// [basic principles]
//
// How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception?
// [thrown exception]
//
// Do I catch or throw exceptions when testing a method?
// [catch or throw]
//
// What naming conventions should I use for test classes
// and test methods?
// [naming conventions]
//
// How do I organize my Test Cases?
// [organize test cases]
//
// What is the best way to integrate JUnit with Ant?
// [integrate with Ant]
//========================================================
